questions.question: They worked hard although there was ……………………….. chance of success.

questions.description: The little means not much but all that there is.

questions.question: There is …………………………. food in the fridge if you are hungry.

questions.question: ………………………… foreigners can write perfect English.
questions.description: Few means hardly any. It has a negative meaning.

questions.question: I would like to ask ………………………… questions.
…………………………. libraries that we have are not properly maintained.
questions.description: The few means not many but all that there is.

questions.question: We did not get …………………………. help.
questions.description: Any is used in negatives and interrogatives.

questions.question: There is …………………………. water in the bottle if you are thirsty.
questions.description: Some is used in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: Will you give me …………………………… to eat?
questions.description: Some is used in interrogative sentences, when we expect an affirmative answer.

questions.question: ……………………………… politicians are really honest.
questions.description: We use few with plural nouns.
